description.narrative: Project title: Promoting gender justice and women economic leadership in some cooperative groups through applying GALS/WEMAN (vi#t t#t: Women Economic Leadership) Duration: 1/3/2016 # 31/3/2017 Project description (150 words) The project aims to promote more equitable gender power relations at household level, more effective producer groups at the community level resulting in increased income for members through application of GALS II. This project combines a gender transformative and value chain development approach focusing on value chain for chicken that is considered to be socially, economically viable for the targeted farmers in Bac Giang, Lao Cai, Ca Mau <(>&<)> Soc Trang province. It targets changes at different levels. At individual <(>&<)> household level, women will be able to have voices in decision making on production and expenditure at family with more equal sharing of household labor between men and women. At community level, through participation and leadership in producer groups, women will gain increased technical knowledge, business, and management skills, respect and confidence. At value chain level, women will have improved access to services andresources for value chain development. Project goal: To enhance women#s economic empowermentand social inclusion in the value chainin Bac Giang , Lao Cai, Ca Mau <(>&<)> Soc Trang provinces Project objective: Objective 1: Women have the decision influence, capacity, confidence and support to benefit from increased social and economic opportunitiesat household and community levels Objective 2: Women in project areas are better organised, more effectively linked up with public and private value chain actors and better ableto negotiate terms and conditions for increasing their benefits. Project partners # Vietnam Women Union # Center for Community Empowerment (CECEM)

participating-org.narrative: In recent years, local Vietnam Women#s Unions have strengthened their support activities for women participating in collective economic models (networking groups, collaborative groups and cooperatives) and simultaneously searched for methods to connect women#s production groups with actors in value chain. Research from the collective economic models in two most disadvantaged areas which are Yen The mountain district in the Northwest of Bac Giang province, and Thach Van commune, a deserted coastal land inThach Ha district,Ha Tinh province has shown positive results of these models. However, there still exist some limitations such as weak linkages among members of vegetables planting collaborative groups; lack of cooperative production spirit; and lack ofequality in labor division between men and women. If women play a key role both in production and in household work, participating in community activities is mostly men#s responsibility with lesser involvement of women. From this observation, GALS (Gender Action Learning System) is a planning tool which Oxfam is promoting for piloting and scaling up in Vietnam to contribute to tackle the aforementioned problems. VietnamWomen#s Union together with Oxfam has committed to co-implement the project.

mailing-address.narrative: PO box 30919, 2500 GX The Hague, The Netherlands

sector.narrative: The right to a sustainable livelihood

description.narrative: Shifted norms & attitudes: # of citizens (M/F), incl.people living in poverty, consider gender equality in workers employment policies and a more gender equal division of labour and income (including unpaid care work), a vital right and good practice.
role models / frontrunners expressing their views during events / on platforms organized by Oxfam and partners
